statement: The EIP-2718 TransactionPayload for type 1 transactions MUST be rlp([chainId, nonce, gasPrice, gasLimit, to, value, data, accessList, signatureYParity, signatureR, signatureS]).
The signature elements (signatureYParity, signatureR, signatureS) MUST represent a secp256k1 signature over keccak256(0x01 || rlp([chainId, nonce, gasPrice, gasLimit, to, value, data, accessList])).
The EIP-2718 ReceiptPayload for type 1 transactions MUST be rlp([status, cumulativeGasUsed, logsBloom, logs]).
For the transaction to be valid, accessList MUST be of type [[{20 bytes}, [{32 bytes}...]]...] (a list of [address, storage_keys] pairs where address is 20 bytes and each storage key is 32 bytes).
Each item in the accessList MUST be a list of exactly 2 elements.
Each address in the accessList MUST be exactly 20 bytes.
The storage keys element of each accessList item MUST be a list.
Each storage key in the accessList MUST be exactly 32 bytes.
ACCESS_LIST_ADDRESS_COST (2400 gas) MUST be charged for each address in the access list.
ACCESS_LIST_STORAGE_KEY_COST (1900 gas) MUST be charged for each storage key in the access list.
The access list gas charge MUST occur at the beginning of execution (at the same time as the intrinsic gas is charged according to EIP-2028 rules).
Addresses from the access list MUST be immediately loaded into the accessed_addresses global set at the beginning of execution.
Storage keys from the access list MUST be immediately loaded into the accessed_storage_keys global set at the beginning of execution (as address-key pairs).
Non-unique addresses and storage keys in the access list MUST be charged for multiple times.
The access list MUST NOT be charged per-byte fees like transaction data.
Type 1 transactions with access lists MUST only be valid as of FORK_BLOCK 12244000.
The transaction MUST only be valid on networks with the specified chainID.
YParity MUST be 0 for even or 1 for odd y-value of the secp256k1 signature.
